title: El Cid 1961 Miriam Restored Honeyko XviD 100% Restored ESP-sub C
description:
El Cid (1961): Drama, War, Romance, Historical Epic, Age of Chivalry,
Kings, Knights, Castles, Christianity, Islam, Jihad, Medieval Spain,
Cast of Ten-Thousand, Charlton Heston, Sophia Loren, Samuel Bronston

-- Samuel Bronston&#039;s epics were the height of Hollywood extravagance.
The restored Miriam print contains the full overture, intermission and
exit sequences with Miklos Rozsa score. Running time 3:08:04.

Video Codec .....: XviD 100% Quality, Insane/Unlimited, DideesHVS, Lem
Frame Size ...........: 720x368, 867x368 Anamorphic DAR
Video FPS ............: 23.976fps
File Size ............: 2.41gb; Original VOB Size: 8.65gb (27.68% comp)
Burn Tested? .........: No. (Insane uses Qpel, so, uh, good luck....)

Audio: English (AC3 5.1 -> DPLII 256Kbps ABR) and Commentary (192Kbps)

Subtitles: English Close-Captioned, Spanish

Extras 
* Anthony Mann - Behind the Camera
* Interviews - Charlton & Lydia Heston and Sophia Loren
* Miklos Rozsa - Maestro of the Movies
* Preserving Our Legacy - Gerry Byrne on Film Preservation & Restoration
* Samuel Bronston - Epic Journey of a Dreamer
* Hollywood Conquers Spain: The Making of El Cid
* El Cid trailers - Theatrical and Restored

Source: NTSC Miriam Collection 2-disc DVD9.

Quality: As this is the restored version, the rip is noticeably better
than anything based off prior commercial releases. (Steer clear of that
horrible "full DVD9" floating around out there; it&#039;s an incredibly bad
700mb old bootleg rip converted back into a hideously bloated VOB-set.)

Soundtrack note: "El Cid" was out-of-print for a very long time; this
includes the original Miklos Rozsa score. There are apparently bootleg
CDs out there containing badly mistimed or mispitched music. There may
also be conductors who&#039;re orchestrating his score at the wrong speed.
...I dunno; I just know that the stuff I&#039;ve heard so far sounds rotten.
